executive_summary.overview: The threat model for Agent Wiz reveals critical vulnerabilities and risks associated with unauthorized access, injection attacks, and denial of service. These findings underscore the need for robust security measures to protect sensitive data and maintain operational integrity in AI orchestration frameworks.
key_findings: Critical risks identified include unauthorized access to threat modeling reports and injection attacks via user input, both rated as high priority.
Denial of service risks and spoofing of user identity present significant threats, necessitating immediate attention.
Current mitigation strategies are insufficient, with all identified risks remaining unmitigated, highlighting a gap in security posture.
strategic_recommendations: Implement role-based access control (RBAC) to secure sensitive reports and enhance authentication mechanisms with multi-factor authentication (MFA).
Sanitize and validate all user inputs to prevent injection attacks, and adopt libraries that automatically escape user inputs.
Establish rate limiting and throttling mechanisms to mitigate denial of service risks, alongside comprehensive logging and monitoring for auditing purposes.
next_steps: Conduct a thorough security review and implement recommended mitigations within the next month.
Regularly audit access controls and API key management to ensure compliance with data protection regulations.
Engage security teams to develop an incident response plan addressing identified vulnerabilities and enhance overall security posture.
